thread.title: Eric Dier sings the "we've got" chant to Dele Alli - and gets it wrong in spectacular fashion
thread.title_full: Eric Dier sings the "we've got" chant to Dele Alli - and gets it wrong in spectacular fashion

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Eric Dier sings the "we've got" chant to Dele Alli - and gets it wrong in spectacular fashion
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Eric Dier and Dele Alli absolutely love each other, spend all their time together and are just the bestest of friends. 
And as the Premier League's hottest couple, you'd expect them to know all their is about each other, right? Wrong. 
Ahead of next month's Red Nose Day , Dele Alli paired up with GAMERAISERS to undertake a few a light-hearted challenges raising awareness for youth homelessness. 
One such challenge, was to get Spurs teammate Eric Dier on the phone and sing his chant to him. "Hang on, what?" (Photo: Twitch) 
Sure enough, January's Premier League Player of the Month gets his best pal on the phone and sings the "I love Eric Dier" chant. 
Alli then requests that Dier reciprocates the challenge. "HAHA" (Photo: Twitch) 
After having the cheek to criticise Alli on his timing and tempo, Dier starts singing, "Dele Alli, Alli" - which is completely wrong. 
We don't even know what the 23-year-old was trying to sing here, although it does sound like the start of the "Steve Gerrard, Gerrard" song. 
Alli is left utterly bemused as he and his radio friends all burst out laughing. 
Eventually, Dier gets it right. But could his mistake spell trouble in paradise for the pair?
